content: renzyGo, please read the forum messages and fix the tags, Constraints and Goal sections. Thanks.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice easy puzzle with a good statement and a lot of examples.
Perhaps you could remove example 2 to reduce the statement length? It's similar to example 1, just that no changes are done. So I think it's obvious, and won't change anything in the code.

Very nice puzzle, I like the idea. But I think you gave too many examples in the description, people can get more hints with tests cases.
I would maybe change the desription about the string s, explicitly write that each pair of character to be replaced and replacement are separated by a space.
I also think the example is to long but pretty interesting problem
Example too long.
:white_check_mark:

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: G O O D

You could change/add a test where the chain of replacements is not given in the same order as the replacements should be made.
For example for test 3 instead of having "ab bc cd de" you could have "de ab cd bc", something like that is currently not tested.
Good puzzle idea, thanks for your contribution :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle, error cases added more fun and difficulty.

Good puzzle idea.
I would probably get rid of "->" in the goal/inputs as such: ox xx pq.
It is the same kind of tweak as reducing verbosity / eye clutter.

*I would change a little bit the description since it's too verbose.

*I would change the first Input line of the game removing the ',' and simply splitting the assignations with the empty space.

*Correct the Example3 and Example4, replace with this one:

Example3:

z->y, y->d, d->a, a->o
5
zzzzz
yyyyy
ddddd
aaaaa
ooooo

In this case, z, y, d, and a all characters end up replacing o.
Thus, the answer is

ooooo
ooooo
ooooo
ooooo
ooooo

Example4:

g->u, u->y, y->y, y->u
4
gggg
uuuu
yyyy
uuuu

This are my advice, and by the way, nice game ;)

Goal section
* It may be better to describe the string not in terms of rows and columns but in terms of lines and lengths, so I suggest the first line is changed to "... in a multi-line string [[m]] of [[n]] lines of length [[n]]."

* It is not necessary to repeat the inputs (as they have been described in the first sentence). So you may:
   • delete "First, ".
   • delete "Next, An integer... figure.".
   • delete "Then, An array... columns.".

* "Below is an example problem." is actually "Below are some example problems." :wink:

Input section
* Suggest to change "An array m for a string." to "A multi-line string [[m]]."

Constraints section
* The first and third constraints look repetitive. Could the third constraint be removed?

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.

Thanks.

"However, in replacing the given string, some of them are not valid as a problem.
Not valid in the caseses is not end up replacement even if following the indication. then output as Error."

-> A set of substitutions is valid if the replacing process is well defined and eventually finishes. If the given set is not valid, output 'ERROR'.

note that you wrote 'Error' in the statement but it's actually 'ERROR' in all caps in the tests

Thank you.
I have fixed the description.
Thanks for writing a clear and understandable description.
Also, thanks for letting me know about 'Error'.

Thank you.
I have fixed the description.
Thanks always for all your kindness and support. (*'ω'*)

Thank you.
I have fixed program problem.
Thanks for letting me know about the fix for the problem I put in the description. I don't noticed it.
I have made a small correction to the description. I also added line breaks to make it easier to read.
Also removed the ',' from the input description and replaced it with a space. Thanks.

Thank you.
I fixed the program problem.
I thought it would be difficult to understand without the arrows, but once they were removed, it was cleaner and easier to see.
The problem itself was also better because the arrows were removed and it was easier to receive input. Thanks.
Thank you.
Thank you.

Thank you.
I added new test cases.
I didn't thought about these test cases, so it was helpful. Thanks.
Thank you.
Thank you.

Thank you.
Indeed. I noticed the description is too long. So I added the sentence (You can skip the example problems. ) when some example problems were gived in the description.

Thank you.
Since this program problem seems to have been approved, I would like to look at the evaluation of the problem, the discussion, etc., and rethink, again, whether to fix to shorten the description.
So, I will leave the description as it is at the moment.
If the evaluation of this program problem is not good, I would like to rewrite at that time. Thanks.

Thank you.
Since this program problem seems to have been approved, I would like to look at the evaluation of the problem, the discussion, etc., and rethink, again, whether to fix to shorten the description.
So, I will leave the description as it is at the moment.
I thought it would be very good to explain the relationship about the space in between the each pair of character to be replaced and replacement. If the evaluation of this program problem is not good, I would like to rewrite by that idea.

Thank you.
Since this program problem seems to have been approved, I would like to look at the evaluation of the problem, the discussion, etc., and rethink, again, whether to fix to shorten the description.
So, I will leave the description as it is at the moment.
And the idea the example 2 be removed from the description was very excellent. If the evaluation of this program problem is not good, I would like to rewrite by that idea.
Thank you.

Thank you.
I read the forum message.
I am sorry for the various mistakes.
Thanks for letting me know that there is a message on the forum message page here.
I fixed the Tag and Constraints and Goal Section.
I also fixed the order of the problems in validator4.
I also fixed the description of the Goal Section, so perhaps the example solution to the Goal Section is not necessary. I thought I would watch the forum messages for a while and remove the example answers if it looks like it will work.
Thanks.
It looks better now, and thank you for following up. :)
you're wecome :)
